courses: Honors: Undergraduate Distinction Scholarship, Undergraduate Research Award, Undergraduate Research Fellowship, Dean’s List

work.summary: Operated as lab manager, ensuring safe environment and productive student collaboration. Offered insight to guide student projects to achieve success. Maintained positive communication with students to develop engaging environment.

Utilized PCB software to modernize company design process, simplifying board development and turnaround. Developed quality procedure setup to enable in‑house verification of hardline cable products. Updated product lines to utilize SMD technology enabling reduction in manufacture time. Provided documentation to streamline engineering design efficiency.

work.company: Peraton Incorporated - USPS Central Repair Facility
work.summary: Developed retrieval system to allow for rapid on‑site screening of dimensioner cameras. Reverse Engineered motor controller leading to 1,200 dollar cost savings per repair. Designed test fixture to allow for rapid testing of system controller leading to reduction of screening time by 50 percent. Wrote documentation to organize system layout and ensure project repeatability.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Fellowship
awards.summary: Prestigious program to develop young undergraduate researchers.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Award
awards.summary: Nominated by faculty member for research efforts.

publications.name: Profiling gem5 Simulator
publications.publisher: 2023 IEEE International Symposium on Performance Analysis of Systems and Software (ISPASS)
publications.summary: J. Umeike, N. Patel, A. Manley, A. Mamandipoor, H. Yun, and M. Alian, ”Profiling gem5 Simulator,” Raleigh, NC, USA, 2023, pp. 103‑113, doi: 10.1109/ISPASS57527.2023.00019.

publications.name: Profiling an Architectural Simulator
publications.publisher: 2022 IEEE International Symposium on Performance Analysis of Systems and Software (ISPASS)
publications.summary: N. Taheri, A. Manley, A. R. Pang, and M. Alian, ”Profiling an Architectural Simulator,” Singapore, Singapore, 2022, pp. 233‑235, doi: 10.1109/ISPASS55109.2022.00032.

projects.name: (AI)-larm: A Modular Home Alarm System
highlights: Served as team lead, coordinating the hardware and software to form the final product.
Designed and prototypes wireless Bluetooth sensors to detect break‑in events.
Developed intuitive interface for user operation.

projects.name: Infrared Communication System
highlights: Developed transmitter and receiver circuit to wirelessly send data via infrared pulses.
Utilized Arduino microcontroller to encode/decode packets while ensuring transmission rate of 2100 bps.

projects.name: Linear Power Supply
highlights: Designed stable power supply able to deliver 11 volts at up to 1 amp, with over current protection.
Simulated the circuit in PSpice before implementing on a protoboard.

projects.name: Vitronic Camera Dimensioner Retrieval System
highlights: Worked with engineers across many disciplines to iterate system designs according to problem requirements.
Prototyped microcontroller‑driven circuit system to achieve motor polarity and braking control.
Manufactured industrial motor control system to ascend and descend pulley system.

projects.name: Automated Car
highlights: Developed software to control servos and motors based on datasheet information and microcontroller’s basic microarchitecture specifications.
Integrated communication through UART and I2C timing protocols.
Utilized Raspberry Pi and RISC‑V ISA development environment.

projects.name: Custom Filter Design
highlights: Calculated design characteristics based on the following parameters: Low Pass, 6kHz cutoff, 5V Gain.
Routed circuit board in OrCAD while adhering to design rules.
